column5: [QUOTE=WallyWarrior;6346996]Did he swipe any Canadian goods while up there? When do you want you're wallet back??? Hopefully you never did anything wrong in you're life, but go ahead and cast that stone! The guy made a mistake and he regrets it to this day. But he is the type of guy that will give you the shirt of his back and then some. In fact he served his country twice in Iraq!
[QUOTE=guest61;6348006]Sometimes you just have to laugh things off. Tell him thanks for his service. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

For god sakes......just add the friggin BIG WHEEL to the list of equipment you own on your tag line so TMG will quit posting the video about you. I don't mind the video content, but your theme song in the video is horrific. Either add the BIG WHEEL, delete the video from YouTube or hire somebody that knows how to produce a better video and song than your family members.......obviously there was heavy drinking involved during the production of the current video. PjShorthorn
PJ. No offense but why don't you put him on your Ignore List in your User CP. I suspect you're mildly entertained by him and enjoy entertaining us as well.
They sell great weed across the counter..... Time to forgive them.
lol
I love the tools that come on the Canada thread and post that they will never go there (here)

Tools....hmmmm. So does that term also include Canadians that never leave their ice fishing house ,that is permanently moored on land , thinking that they will catch the next 40 walleye? As far as the WC contigent that doesn't want to visit Canada......yep......tool masters. PjShorthorn
You are likely better off without them anyway.

I'm quite fine if people don't want to go there,. . .. . ..less traffic!! I don't go to another country and complain about how they do things, I do compare, but not complain. I will always go to Canada as long as they will allow me🍁 (the "differences" is what I like!) Maybe one day I'll get to meet the famous V-bay Gord! Chuck

we don't have felonies & misdemeanors....we have summary offenses (minor) and indictable offences (serious)theft under $5000 will give the crown (prosecuting) attorney the option to consider proceeding summarily or indictablyif it's your first offense and it's reasonably minor, they'll proceed summarilyif you were caught for stealing a bike in the US and got dinged with a misdemeanor, our system would likely consider that similar to a summary conviction and might let you in.Beat someone up with a pipe? GTFO.If you bomb US servicemen for Al Qaeda though, we'll welcome you back to Canada and give you $10 million bucks for your troubles. Fking ridiculous...https://www.cnn.com/2017/07/04/ameri...ent/index.html
You better hurry, I'm older than dirt already.... (yes, I know this photo is upside down but it adds a maniacal quality don't you think?)

Our group had a similar experience back before passports. One guy had a DUI many years earlier and had no problems for about 5 years. That year they let him pay $250 for a week long get out of jail free pass, I guess. They said they didn't want to ruin 9 other guy's trip. He was told when he got home to fill out some paperwork to prove that he was rehabilitated. He learned that he had to pay another $250 to file the paperwork. He never did it, but told us that he did. About 6 years later when he was riding with me they caught him again. They told me that I was welcome in Canada, but I had to get him out of Canada right now! They even stood in the road until I disappeared over the bridge.
Canada can have itself, I have no use for it. All the silly games. There are plenty of black flies, mosquitoes and walleye in the good ol USA
Those pesky Canucks. Who do they think they are having their own rules and laws for their country? I'm pretty sure if you & Bobby will continue your boycott their economy will collapse.
I can't agree more......... My saying is "Everything is ILLEGAL in CanaDA". Wait until they ban fat f**** in CanaDA then Minnesota Fats will not be allowed in either..... LOL
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U8b0kXQ4-bs Ahh Bobby, some days you make my life so easy.
Did he swipe any Canadian goods while up there?Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

They seem to know everything about the driver or owner of the vehicle when you pull up to that window in Canada. Three years ago I bought a new truck after having the old one for 12 years. The first thing the border guys says to me is "I see that you got a new truck." A few years earlier we changed resorts and the guy says "Going to a new resort?" They have a lot of info on us in their system.

Maybe Google is a front for the FBI and they have as much info on each of us? Ya know, use our tax dollars for the gathering cost. Skim a bunch of the ad revenue. Ummmm, I might be onto something here.
If only the US was so picky about who they let in!

Not only don't we care if you are a felon, we will even let you continue your current occupation as a felon and give you free health insurance to boot. And all we want to do is spend money up north..........yes I'm getting to suspect those pesky old Canadians see whats going on down south and for them, we are down south!
Found out a member of our party has a misdemeanor of theft from 3 years ago. Will there be an issue at the border or have people in the same situation been allowed to enter Canada?

It all depends what the crime was. They match the crime against our criminal code. If it’s a summary offence here, and there’s no other skeletons hiding, they should allow him in. Be advised that a lot of crimes don’t match up. DUI being the most obvious one.
Summary offense? From what I know it was a misameaner A and he has an otherwise spotless record.
Have him drive his own vehicle. If he isn't allowed in he can drive himself home. No sense ruining everybody's trip.

honestly and from my experinces.....the border will do whatever they want, when they want. We had a guy in our group that had gone up for 20 years and had an assault/battery on his record the whole time....never bothered him...ever and then 1 year we had a guy with a DUI...he didnt get in and we knew that was a chance so he was just going to get a room in I. Falls and fish rainy until we came back....they also decided not to let our other friend come over that had been coming over the past 20 years, who 3 weeks before was in canada in toronto earlier. So...you just never know. No matter what the border fold tell you over the phone and how much you pay for paperwork.

I would think it's possible that a class A misdemeanor could be a felony in canada. 1st time dui in Illinois is a misdemeanor and is considered a felony in canada. I would say he will be denied entry into canada if they catch it.

Sounds like it would be classified as a Summary Conviction Offences under Section 322 & 334, theft under $5,000. The Tank, a DUI is a felony in Canada regardless of how it is classified in the states.
That's what I'm saying. His misdemeanor maybe considered a felony up there just like a dui.

Just an update. Our member who had the misdemeanor had no problem crossing into Canada. He had a passport and was never questioned on his conviction. The crossing guard was more interested in the minor child that we had. Had all his paperwork and notes from both parents.

Good to hear. Yeah, they are keying on minors now. One of our guards at Emerson let a father in with his four kids, who he was suppose to have no contact with, through without checking. Never talked to the kids or checked. Thankfully, the FBI and RCMP were able to track his bank transfer, and got the kids and arrested the guy and his wife.
